channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-1751] Exceptions after/while installing 6.1 P2
item.description:
Errors appear on containers log files when creating child containers of root container, which is patched.
There are 2 situations:
1)Child container is created and profile version is specified in creation dialog in hawtio. (karaf_profile.log)
2)Child container is created with unpatched profile version and migrated to patched profile version later. (karaf_migrated.log)

<iocanel_> it seems to me that the patching service does apply changes, but it doesn't modify the files used during the child container creation
<iocanel_> so the child seems to use mix of patched and unpatched stuff leading to having multiple versions of some bundles (e.g. fabric-agent)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Gathered some extra information chatting to Elena.

  • The BindException seems to indicate that the port is already in use, but the attached netstat.txt doesn't really show anything else listening on that port. This issue doesn't happen before patching the root container, so probably a second version of the same bundle active somewhere?
  • There are also some exceptions in the root container log, similar to the "Unable to update agent" errors in the child container. These might just be transient errors because in the end, the child container does get provisioned correctly. Not sure we can prevent that type of exception when updating the agent itself, but we should probably mention/log that this might happen then.
  • Finally, there's another exception at shutdown - looking at the stacktrace's source locations, it's also the patched bundle version that's causing the issue there.
Still unable to reproduce most of the issues reported - would it be possible to zip up the contents of instances/child1 and instances/child2 and attach those archives as well?

Archives can be available by the following links:
child1: https://drive.google.com/a/redhat.com/file/d/0B6EdER_Tg5J-U2xhZ0p5NHBxZXM
child2: https://drive.google.com/a/redhat.com/file/d/0B6EdER_Tg5J-RTdQakRGS1QtLTg
The files are too large too attach them in Jira.

Hope it helps!

Hi,
I am not able to reproduce.

I can see this exception:

io.fabric8.fabric-agent[io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent] : Unable to update agent
 
java.lang.NullPointerException
 
	at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.searchImports(BundleWiringImpl.java:1553)
 
	at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.findClassOrResourceByDelegation(BundleWiringImpl.java:1484)
 
	at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.access$400(BundleWiringImpl.java:75)
 
	at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl$BundleClassLoader.loadClass(BundleWiringImpl.java:1955)
 
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:358)
 
	at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent.installFeatureConfigs(DeploymentAgent.java:1227)
 
	at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent.doUpdate(DeploymentAgent.java:573)
 
	at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent$2.run(DeploymentAgent.java:293)
 
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)
 
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
 
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

after installing patch R2 and upgrading container.

I have retested the issue with Patch R2P2:

I was not able to migrate child containers to new version based on patches R2 and R2P2. I was getting the following after migration in both cases described in the Jira:

JBossFuse:karaf@root> container-list
 
[id]                           [version] [connected] [profiles]                                         [provision status]
 
root*                          1.1       true        fabric, fabric-ensemble-0000-1, jboss-fuse-full    success
 
  test                         1.1       true        default                                            error - org.osgi.service.resolver.ResolutionException: Unable to resolve dummy/0.0.0: missing requir
 
  test2                        1.1       true        default                                            error - org.osgi.service.resolver.ResolutionException: Unable to resolve dummy/0.0.0: missing requir

In the karaf.log of 1st container was:

2015-04-01 17:40:51,214 | ERROR | agent-1-thread-1 | DeploymentAgent                  | .fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent$2  255 | 60 - io.fabric8.fabric-agent - 1.0.0.redhat-424 | Unable to update agent
 
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Invalid BundleContext.
 
	at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleContextImpl.checkValidity(BundleContextImpl.java:517)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.0.3.redhat-610379.jar:]
 
	at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleContextImpl.getServiceReference(BundleContextImpl.java:359)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.0.3.redhat-610379.jar:]
 
	at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent.installFeatureConfigs(DeploymentAgent.java:1000)[60:io.fabric8.fabric-agent:1.0.0.redhat-424]
 
	at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent.doUpdate(DeploymentAgent.java:526)[60:io.fabric8.fabric-agent:1.0.0.redhat-424]
 
	at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent$2.run(DeploymentAgent.java:252)[60:io.fabric8.fabric-agent:1.0.0.redhat-424]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)[:1.7.0_45]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)[:1.7.0_45]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)[:1.7.0_45]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)[:1.7.0_45]
 
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744)[:1.7.0_45]
 
2015-04-01 17:40:51,215 | INFO  | agent-1-thread-1 | DeploymentAgent                  | io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent  318 | 60 - io.fabric8.fabric-agent - 1.0.0.redhat-424 | FabricService not available
 
2015-04-01 17:40:51,312 | INFO  | agent-1-thread-1 | DeploymentAgent                  | io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent 1212 | 60 - io.fabric8.fabric-agent - 1.0.0.redhat-424 | Using Felix thread pool for download manager.
 
2015-04-01 17:40:52,755 | ERROR | agent-1-thread-1 | DeploymentAgent                  | .fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent$2  296 | 60 - io.fabric8.fabric-agent - 1.0.0.redhat-424 | Unable to update agent
 
org.osgi.service.resolver.ResolutionException: Unable to resolve dummy/0.0.0: missing requirement [dummy/0.0.0] osgi.identity; osgi.identity=fabric-git-server; type=karaf.feature; version=0 [caused by: Unable to resolve fabric-git-server/1.0.0.redhat-379: missing requirement [fabric-git-server/1.0.0.redhat-379] osgi.identity; osgi.identity=io.fabric8.fabric-git-server; type=osgi.bundle; version="[1.0.0.redhat-429,1.0.0.redhat-429]" [caused by: Unable to resolve io.fabric8.fabric-git-server/1.0.0.redhat-429: missing requirement [io.fabric8.fabric-git-server/1.0.0.redhat-429] osgi.wiring.package; filter:="(&(osgi.wiring.package=io.fabric8.git)(version>=1.0.0)(!(version>=1.1.0)))" [caused by: Unable to resolve io.fabric8.fabric-git/1.0.0.redhat-429: missing requirement [io.fabric8.fabric-git/1.0.0.redhat-429] osgi.wiring.package; filter:="(&(osgi.wiring.package=io.fabric8.internal)(version>=1.0.0)(!(version>=2.0.0)))" [caused by: Unable to resolve io.fabric8.fabric-core/1.0.0.redhat-423: missing requirement [io.fabric8.fabric-core/1.0.0.redhat-423] osgi.wiring.package; filter:="(&(osgi.wiring.package=org.fusesource.common.util)(version>=1.0.0)(!(version>=2.0.0)))"]]]]
 
	at org.apache.felix.resolver.Candidates.populateResource(Candidates.java:285)[60:io.fabric8.fabric-agent:1.0.0.redhat-424]
 
	at org.apache.felix.resolver.Candidates.populate(Candidates.java:153)[60:io.fabric8.fabric-agent:1.0.0.redhat-424]
 
	at org.apache.felix.resolver.ResolverImpl.resolve(ResolverImpl.java:148)[60:io.fabric8.fabric-agent:1.0.0.redhat-424]
 
	at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentBuilder.resolve(DeploymentBuilder.java:245)[60:io.fabric8.fabric-agent:1.0.0.redhat-424]
 
	at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent.doUpdate(DeploymentAgent.java:567)[60:io.fabric8.fabric-agent:1.0.0.redhat-424]
 
	at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent$2.run(DeploymentAgent.java:293)[60:io.fabric8.fabric-agent:1.0.0.redhat-424]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)[:1.7.0_45]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)[:1.7.0_45]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)[:1.7.0_45]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)[:1.7.0_45]
 
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744)[:1.7.0_45]

There was no fuse.log for that container.
In the log of the second container were the same issues.
The same behavior reported in https://issues.jboss.org/browse/ENTESB-2537

Also after creatying fabric in patched Fuse with P2R2 the follwoing exception is printef to Fuse console:

After creating fabric:
 
 
 
io.fabric8.fabric-agent[io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent] : Unable to update agent
 
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Invalid BundleContext.
 
	at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleContextImpl.checkValidity(BundleContextImpl.java:517)
 
	at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleContextImpl.getServiceReference(BundleContextImpl.java:359)
 
	at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent.installFeatureConfigs(DeploymentAgent.java:1000)
 
	at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent.doUpdate(DeploymentAgent.java:526)
 
	at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent$2.run(DeploymentAgent.java:252)
 
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)
 
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
 
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744)
Closing since workaround https://access.redhat.com/solutions/1363593 solves the issue with child container startup.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1)fabric:create
2)Patch fabric through hawtio (Runtime->Manage->Apply Patch to version)
or using commands:

JBossFuse:karaf@root> fabric:version-create 1.1
 
Created version: 1.1 as copy of: 1.0
 
JBossFuse:karaf@root> fabric:patch-apply --version 1.1 -u admin -p admin file:///home/emedvede/patch/jboss-fuse-6.1.0.redhat-379-p2.zip

In hawtio:
3)Migrate root container to version 1.1
4)Create a child container and in create dialog select profile version 1.1
5)Wait for container provision
There are errors in child container log:

2014-07-30 15:18:10,597 | INFO  | FelixStartLevel  | SshServerFactory                 | karaf.shell.ssh.SshServerFactory   60 | 39 - org.apache.karaf.shell.ssh - 2.3.0.redhat-610387 | Error updating SSH server
 
java.net.BindException: Address already in use


2014-07-30 15:18:14,631 | ERROR | o.fabric8.agent) | configadmin                      | ?                                   ? | 6 - org.apache.felix.configadmin - 1.4.0.redhat-610379 | Cannot use configuration io.fabric8.agent for [org.osgi.service.cm.ManagedService, id=263, bundle=62/mvn:io.fabric8/fabric-agent/1.0.0.redhat-387]: No visibility to configuration bound to mvn:io.fabric8/fabric-agent/1.0.0.redhat-379


2014-07-30 15:18:18,077 | ERROR | agent-1-thread-1 | DeploymentAgent                  | .fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent$2  255 | 87 - io.fabric8.fabric-agent - 1.0.0.redhat-379 | Unable to update agent
 
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: io/fabric8/agent/DeploymentAgent$5
 
	at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent.refreshPackages(DeploymentAgent.java:932)
 
	at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent.install(DeploymentAgent.java:726)
 
	at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent.doUpdate(DeploymentAgent.java:525)
 
	at io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent$2.run(DeploymentAgent.java:252)[87:io.fabric8.fabric-agent:1.0.0.redhat-379]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)[:1.7.0_45]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)[:1.7.0_45]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)[:1.7.0_45]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)[:1.7.0_45]
 
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744)[:1.7.0_45]
 
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Unable to load class 'io.fabric8.agent.DeploymentAgent$5' because the bundle wiring for io.fabric8.fabric-agent is no longer valid.
 
	at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.findClassOrResourceByDelegation(BundleWiringImpl.java:1494)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.0.3.redhat-610379.jar:]

The second scenario:
4)Create a child container and in create dialog select profile version 1.0
and after it starts migrate it to version 1.1
